replies.bodyText:
I guess that the primary use of this function is internal for the secret creation (create a new secret or add a version to an existing secret). Thereby, the version is useless in this context.
However, if we want to offer a convenient interface to developer, it could be interesting. If you agree, I propose these interfaces:
boolean secretExists(String secretId);// Check latest version in default project
boolean secretExists(String secretId, String version); // Check specific version in default project
boolean secretExists(String secretId, String version, String projectId);// // Check specific version in specific project

Like for your getSecretString comment, I won't be able to keep boolean secretExists(String secretId, String projectId); because of method signature conflict with boolean secretExists(String secretId, String version);
Let me know.
replies.author: guillaumeblaquiere

replies.bodyText: Yeah let's omit adding secretExists(String secretId, String versionName, String projectId), since it would conflict with existing method signature and I think its value is relatively limited as you say with it being primarily internal.
